author: Gus_263
title: Chance to get a classic minifigure
review:
This set (keychain) was sold commonly in the Lego shops at 2002 (was released early, but wasn't considered a set to sell). This keychain is a minifigure, the minifigure of the "Captain Roger", sometimes called the "captain redbeard". 

This minifigure is rare now, but during the years of the lego pirates theme, this minifiguyre was common, released with notable sets, and also with small ones, like minifigure packs. Altough the details are simple, the shape (the original Lego minifigure shape), and color scheme (black, red and some brown, yellow and green colors in each deails), makes it well made. The hat, hook and wood leg are cool and original increasements.

Overall, it is rare and is useful to any Lego pirates or just classic Lego fan. If you find this by a price of a common keychain, it will be a good chance to get a nice minifigure. A 4,7 regarding this set as a keychain.

author: hustla187
title: Good Keychain
review: If you are looking for a good Lego keychain, this is it. You get Captain Roger or somtimes Captain Redbeard. This is a good way to get a classic minifigure but as a keychain. This is an excellent one to pick up.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Gear (Key Chains/Pirates) - Captain Roger Key Chain Review
review:
This key chain is part of the LEGO Pirates theme. It's a really cool minifig to have as a key chain but the only problems I have with those is that you're not able to take off the legs, or the head.

Pros

  • Minifig looks cool

Cons

  • Legs, head and/or headgear don't come off

Summary

All in all it's a great set to get and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.
